findings.title: Denial of Service (DoS) attacks
findings.description: A type of cyber attack where an attacker floods a network or system with traffic, disrupting its normal operations.

findings.title: Wallet vulnerabilities
findings.description: Ethereum wallets can be vulnerable to hacking or other types of cyber attacks.

findings.title: 51% Attack Vulnerability
findings.description: A 51% attack occurs when a single entity or group of entities controls more than half of the computing power on a proof-of-work (PoW) blockchain, allowing them to alter transaction history and block new transactions. This can also be used to deny service to other users.

findings.title: 51% Attack Vulnerability
findings.description: A 51% attack occurs when a single entity or group of entities controls more than half of the computing power on a proof-of-work (PoW) blockchain, allowing them to alter transaction history and block new transactions. An attacker could use their control to deny service to other users.

findings.title: Reverse transactions
findings.description: An attacker could potentially reverse transactions that have already been completed, allowing them to double spend their own coins.

findings.title: Block new transactions
findings.description: An attacker could block new transactions from being added to the blockchain, effectively halting all activity on the network.

findings.title: Deny service
findings.description: An attacker could use their control of the network to deny service to other users, preventing them from accessing the network.
